headline: Easy Cajun Jambalaya
description: Chicken breast and kielbasa are sauteed with green pepper, onion celery and garlic, then stewed with chicken stock and rice. This version is lightly spiced, in response to those a little more sensitive to pepper.

video.description: A simple jambalaya with chicken and kielbasa without the spicy heat.
video.name: Easy Cajun Jambalaya

name: Easy Cajun Jambalaya
recipeIngredient: 2 boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size pieces
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add chicken and kielbasa; sauté until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Stir in onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic. Season with cayenne, onion powder, salt, and pepper; cook and stir until onion is tender and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add rice and stir in chicken stock and bay leaves. Bring to a boil; reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes, or until rice is tender. Stir in Worcestershire sauce and hot pepper sauce.

review.reviewBody: Ohhhh so yummy!!! We all loved it and decided this one is going to have to make the rotation of our most favorite meals! Because my 83 year old mother doesn't eat onions, peppers or spicy seasonings, I cut the onion and bell pepper in quarters so it would be easy to pick out of her meal but the taste would still be there! I also omitted the cayenne pepper and hot sauce and used shrimp instead of chicken. The taste was still absolutely delicious!!!

This turned out great! Followed the recipe pretty close but I did add some gold potatoes since I didn’t have any celery on hand. Excellent recipe for a Cajun inspired tomatoless Jambalaya. I seasoned it with Greek Seasoning, Secret Aardvark Serrabanero, and added butter. Really nice recipe to use with leftover proteins like we did. Used leftover chicken breast, chicken sausages, and ground turkey patties.

This was wonderful and easy! I agree that it needed tomatoes so I added a 15oz can of diced tomatoes! I did cut the rice back to 1.5 cups and thus cut the broth down to 3 cups. Nice flavor! I am in Minnesota so don't know authentic Cajun but it worked for us. Thank you for the easy recipe!

This recipe is so good... And easy! I've actually made it a few times..only change I have made was to add a can of tomato sauce (mainly because it struck me as oddly pale the first time I made it.... and I may have gotten a little heavy handed with the seasoning... I made the Cajun seasoning I found on the board, but its so yummy... Thank you for sharing this recipe!
Five stars! I made this exactly as the recipe is written. It was fantastic. Everyone loved it and agreed we will definitely make this a regular meal at our house.

This is really good! I decreased the rice to 1 cup uncooked rice, and made it separately. Used only 2 cups of chicken broth (not stock). Added 1 can of Ro-tel tomatoes, 14.5 oz tomato sauce and some shrimp.

Fine recipe that worked better for my family with a few modifications as per reviewer recommendations. I used a pound of shrimp instead of chicken, added in the last five minutes of cooking instead of up front, and also added a can of diced tomatoes with the broth. I used only two cups of broth in the jambalaya as I cooked my rice separately in another cup and a half of broth.
Turned out okay for me = diabetic diet. Adjustments made.
I made this for my fiance and I. I stuck to the recipe only adding one 24oz can of crushed tomatoes with herbs. you can also top this recipe with mild shredded cheddar

It’s pretty good, but I would decrease the 2 cups of uncooked rice to only 1 cup, use more kielbasa and slice it instead of dice it. I actually used leftover Thanksgiving turkey instead of chicken and it was a great way to use it up. This would also be good with kielbasa and shrimp instead of chicken. My husband loved it.
easy and tasty

It was spicy, our 11 year old liked the flavor but not the heat. My wife and I loved it, very tasty.
Of course, one simply reduces the cayenne to reduce the heat.

This was a hit even with my very fussy 9 year old granddaughter. I used chicken broth instead of stock because it's what I had and I left out the hot sauce because I added a can of Rotel. I will definitely be making this again.
I added shrimp and a few jalapeños. Two cups rice is a bit much so I use only one cup and then two cups less chicken broth. This is a family fav!
I’d like a little tomato paste and some okra
Made it vegan with light life italian sausage, morning star chik'n strips, and veggie broth. Delicious!
This is a great way to dress up kielbasa. I did not use chicken. I used 2 packages of kielbasa and added one can of tomatoes. My family really liked it.
This recipe nice simple tasty but I did add some Cajun seasoning and a little salt and pepper it needed that little pinch of something otherwise it would be a little bit too plain for me.
This was great! I substituted a poblano pepper, for an allergy to bells. I also added 1/2tsp Cumin and 1/2C diced tomato. It was a mildly spicy but DELICIOUS! May add Shrimp in next time!

This was a great basic recipe to start with for my first time! We followed it step by step but also adding what our family likes. Our first addition was adding Portuguese linguisa with the rest of the meat. We then added a can of diced tomatoes after the veggies and seasoning. We allowed the onions to translucent before adding rice and chicken stock with bay leaves like stated but added the chicken stock slowly as the the rice cooked in the remaining grease from meat! We cooked shrimp in a different pot with other hot spices and vinegar to add to the main dish for those who like it spicy.

Excellent recipe. I used andouille sausage in place of the kielbasa cuz I had no kielbasa. Also added shrimp at the end as I always do. (I’ve made jambalaya quite a few times before). I also cooked the rice separately. Each recipe I’ve tried prior is a bit different in ingredients and taste but I must say, this is as good as any jambalaya I ate when vacationing in New Orleans! I will definitely be using this easy recipe again!
I used chicken andouille sausage and creole seasoning! It was a hit with my coworkers and it wasn't too spicy!

Very easy and pretty tasty. I forgot to add the diced tomatoes as mentioned by one reviewer, I think that would have made a difference. You definitely need to add way more flavor, extra onion powder, garlic powder, salt pepper, Cajun seasoning etc. People will need to taste test and season according to your liking. Great recipe. Oh....and I also added shrimp. Next time I will try to add spinach as well.
It was not bad if you follow the recipe I am sure. We changed it up a little and used red and yellow bell peppers instead to add color and a little different flavor.

I stuck with the original recipe but did add a can of diced tomatoes with peppers and a half cup of mushrooms. 
The beauty of jambalaya is that you can toss in just about anything that strikes your fancy. A great recipe when you’re pressed for time but have a hungry horde to feed.

I love Louisiana cuisine! This recipe is simple yet full of flavor. I did tweak a few ingredients and added a touch of Creole to this recipe. I do cook my rice separately as not to end up with mush, just add it about 10 min before you serve to allow the rice to soak up the juices and flavors.

This recipe makes a very tasty Jambalaya in general. I substituted 12 oz shrimp for the chicken, and used 14 oz of kielbasa. I recommend using 4-1/2 to 5 cups of chicken stock because the rice will use all of it before becoming tender. Add the shrimp with the last two ingredients and cook 5 minutes longer.
Even I was amazed at how good it came out, my family and friends loved it ..,,

Jambalaya calls for tomatoes, so I added a can of fire-roasted tomatoes. I also added 1 lb large shelled shrimp. With a few minor adjustments, it turned out to be a good jambalaya. The tweaked recipe is a keeper. We're having this today!
This dish is delicious! I did take others suggestions and cooked the rice separate. I also added a can of diced tomatoes. My 12 year old loved this and asked for more.
I added a can of rotel. Use 2 tsp celery seed instead of celery. 3 cups chicken stock 3 cups beef stock. Jalapano cheese sausage and chicken breast seasoned with Cajun seasoning. This was incredible

This was super easy to make and my husband even ate it when he was sick. I add a little more hot sauce than called for and more celery and peppers to make the rice to everything else ratio a little less.
I make this often. And usually my go to recipe when taking a dish to another family and pot lucks. Always a hit.
Added white wine
Added some more spice to it because I like it hot, but very good base recipe for easy jambalaya!
I see beans in the picture but not in the ingredient list. Am I missing it? I plan to make this for dinner tonight. I bought a can of beans just in case.
It was very quick to make and family loves it. I added a can of red kidney beans to it too.
I also added a can of diced tomatoes and shrimp to this recipe but I like the simplicity of required ingredients in it and think it is easily adaptable to what you have on hand..

I kept to the recipe and I will continue to make it again and again it's going to be my go-to recipe!!!
YUMMY ??

Tried this tonight, stayed true to the recipe (except I let people pepper sauce to their liking, cuz I'm a wimp.) It was a hit with everyone, from the 8 year old all the way up to dad! We are definitely adding this to our rotation!
I needed to ramp up the spice. 3 stars for recipe as written. 5 stars when upping spice amount and adding a red pepper and using andoulli sausage.
Big hit with my family. Added tomatoes as suggested by others.

I found this to be exactly what I was looking for. I needed a recipe with low heat for my first attempt at Jambalaya. The changes I made: I used Hillshire Farms smoked andouille sausage instead of kielbasa. It has a mild heat. I added two tablespoons of tomato paste to give it more of the red color. At the end of the cooking, I added a pound of shrimp and continued to cook it until the shrimp were just opaque. I served it with a baguette and a side of sour cream (especially for my daughter-in-law who cannot take very much heat in her food). I found the heat to be very acceptable and this is now one of my favorite recipes which I plan on making again.
This dish is a keeper! It was quick and easy to make, very tasty, and my family loved it!
I added a can of diced tomatoes and cajun seasoning based on other reviews. Glad I did as it made it taste a lot better than what it would've been.

This recipe is amazing!!! It is so quick and easy. I usually make it with sausage, chicken thighs and shrimp. I also use brown rice instead of white rice. I think it helps it keep some body and texture. It is also very easy to spice up to your desired level. I have made this several times and it is always a hit with the whole family (including a 6 y/o and 3y/o). I have even had requests to make this for get togethers with friends!!
Very good recipe.

Never made jambalaya before, but I desperately needed new ideas for dinner. I noted the lack of spice in this recipe, so I just looked up Cajun seasoning recipes. About 1 tsp per spice. Everything else I kept the same. Keep in mind the spice recipe I used gave the jumbalaya a good kick.

I was really afraid of trying to make Jambalaya. But, I did using this recipe and it was awesome! I read the reviews and did a couple of recommended modifications to be sure it wasn't too spicy, the rice wasn't gummy and the shrimp weren't overcooked! This is my go to recipe for Jambalaya now.
Blech. Heat with no flavour. Would never make it again. Creoles everywhere are spinning in their tombs..
It was really easy, fast & delicious! The only change I made was an addition: ground sausage as well as the chicken & smoked sausage!
Too much rice for the other ingredients. Next time I will greatly reduce the quantity of rice. But without the rice the dish had a good flavor.

easy, with just enough kick. 
Seems like it needs tomato or something.

Made it as is, I agree not enough water for the rice, but easily fixed. Not your standard jambalaya recipe. Needed more cajun style ingredients like thyme but if you want a different twist on jambalaya this could work.
This is delicious. I used hot sausage and chicken and that gave it a pretty hefty kick. Next time kielbasa. This one is a keeper!

I'm giving this 4 stars. Not bad, but A Lot of rice. If I do make this again (which is a strong possibility later in life), I will make the rice seperate. The rice cooked fine, just was much more than my family likes. And we Like rice.
I didn't add the hot sauce (cause I don't do spicy at all). But without that "something" I found it bland. So maybe next time I'll get some mild chilies to put in it.

I have made this dish multiple times and it is always a hit...but I make a few tweaks, I use 6 cloves garlic (chopped), 2 tsp. Cajun seasoning, and extra 1/2 c. chopped celery, 2 (14.5 oz.) cans diced tomatoes, with liquid and add 1/2 lb. shrimp just as it boils before I put the lid on. It always comes out amazing! Good luck!
Yes I added I more cup of chicken broth & added coriander & annatto for color.

I think this is very solid recipe, for a quick Jambalaya! I had to substitute Old Bay seasoning for the bay leaves in the recipe (not by choice but because it's what I had). I also added a little extra chicken broth as another reviewer suggested. I think this is very good, for the time invested. Will definitely make again, thank you for the recipe.

This took me about an hour, so I wouldn't really consider it "easy". But, it turned out AMAZING without having to do any adjustments to the recipe. It still has kick, but is milder than traditional jambalaya. That combined with the freshness made this a winner for me. Thoroughly enjoyed!
I made this following the original recipe and we loved it. I will made this again when we want jambalaya.
A little bland for us
we did like it with the tomatoes. everyone enjoyed it : adults and children ages 8-13!

I made this recipe for dinner tonight. It was really good. Really, really good. My husband cleaned his plate. The kids didn't touch it, but that's normal around here. lol. It was spicy and flavorful. The ONLY change I made was to add 1/2 can tomato purée and another cup of chicken stock because the rice was still crunchy. I will definitely make this again.

This was a nice, simple recipe that was easy to make in about an hour. It is a great starter if your family is only just getting into spicier dishes and it doesn't take much to amp it up. Very happy with this and I will be making it many times over.
Great flavor and easy recipe! Somehow my rice ended up mushy so I will cook it separately next time.
Loved it! Will definitely be making this again.

We loved it. It was not too hot for my picky husband. I followed the recipe exactly. My only mistake was that I should have adjusted the servings. It made a huge amount. I enough to share with my adult son. He liked it so much he asked if I had any more left.
Will definitely make again. Delicious! I did not add hot sauce at end of recipe since it was spicy enough for us. Thanks for sharing.
I haven't made this yet but plan on doing so. Question....the picture shows beans but I do not see any in the actual recipe....????

This was delicious and a huge hit with my little family. I added some Cajun seasoning as well as creole red beans (creamy style). I always go heavy on the garlic too. It was fantastic! I'll definitely be making it again.
I like this as a basic recipe. I added a can of crushed tomatoes and it took it where my family likes it.
I added diced tomatoes, shrimp and used andouille sausage, also made rice separate using half of the broth and other half in the pot.
i read the recipe youforgot the shalots and the onion the real flavor is in the bones i know im from BR La and this recipe dont deserve a rating to get this submited i have to give it a star

I made this. It was fantastic. I did make a couple changes to the recipe. I like it spicy, so I did this:

1. 1/2 teaspoon of cayenne. (Doubled the amount)
2. Added 1/4th of Tony's creole seasoning
3. Was generous with the salt and pepper.

All in all, a great recipe. thank you to the person that shared!

My family said this needs to be a staple meal around here. It was awesome! I did less hot sauce than it called for because of the kids and then my husband and I put extra on ours on our plates. I love how easy this was. Especially since I already had diced peppers and onions in the freezer from a meal the week before. I also used plain rice that was left over from a meal a few days before. I cut down the chicken broth by about 1 1/2 cups because of it. Easy and tasty! Thanks for the great recipe!

My kids and I loved this! I made a few changes. I used butter instead of olive oil, omitted the chicken and substituted shrimp. I added smoked paprika to taste and left out all other dry spices and substituted it with 2 tsps. of Weber of N Orleans Cajun Seasoning. I loved that it was broth based instead of tomato based. We will make this again!
Although it was a little too much rice it was very tasty. i would make it again with half the rice and then half the broth.

I have no idea what a genuine jabmalaya is like. I followed most of this recipe using chorizo sausage and adding a few extra cajun spices such as oregano. I also added a few mushrooms. The result was fantastic. One of the best meals I've cooked in a long time. I cooking it again this weekend. Thanks.

Upped the amount of vegetables and kielbasa, and added a tsp of Paprika.

Update - 3/5/2017: Also, goes well with carrots.

Delicious! I did make some big changes. I added 1 can of diced tomatoes with green chili, 1 can of tomato paste, 1 tsp gumbo file, 1/4 tsp cayenne, 1 tsp garlic powder, 2 additional cups of chicken stock. My friends loved it!
Amazing! Used shrimp and andouille sausage and skipped the Worcestershire sauce. Wasn't a grain of rice left!

It was an easy and quick recipe. I had eft -over peppers - both red and green - from a veggie platter. I even used left-over roasted chicken! There was enough heat to please my husband, yet mild enough for my sensitive tummy. I will definitely make this again, maybe adding some shrimp and okra. Thanks for sharing.!
Not really Cajun by any means but still a really easy meal to make. I followed the instruction and it was a snap. Next time i will make it i will put my own spin on it.

Made as written. Found this to be simple and tasty however, adding the uncooked rice and broth to the already cooked chicken and then cooking for 20 minutes or so leads to an overdone boiled chicken taste.
If I made this again, would cook rice separately!
Sooooo Good

I am giving this 4 stars because is a pretty good recipe but kielbasa in a jambalaya? No way. You need andouille. And to the people who think it needs tomatoes, that's not Cajun.The difference between Cajun and creole cooking is creole dishes use tomatoes and Cajun dishes do not.
My husband and I loved it!! I did not have any bell pepper so I used jalapeños I had on hand. ?? Will definitely make again.

Delicious! Due to not having celery, I used peas and cubed zucchini instead. Instead of boneless chicken and kielbasa I used jalapeno chicken sausage. Dish still had enough meat and provided a great spice level. My husband and I both give a double thumbs up!
it was easy to make and tasted great. I added a can of dark red kidney beans without the juice. it went well together.

This was my first time making a jambalaya and I was very impressed!!
I didn't have any celery on hand and it is bursting with flavor without it.
I did add an extra cup and a half of chicken broth to the recipe, as the rice was too sticky for my liking.

This is definitely going to be a regular for my clients!

Great recipe! Very easy to follow and fairly simple. It had a perfect spice and I thought that all of the flavors blended in perfect harmony! My sister said it was way too spicy, so if you aren't in to heat this is not the recipe for you. Overall great recipe that I will definitely use again.

I have used this recipe a lot. I prepare it as written, but I sometimes put a little more peppers, onions, and celery. It’s delicious and my son gets so excited when I tell him that’s what we’re having for dinner. Thank you for a great recipe!
Bland and mushy

Easy, and very good. Will make it again. 

Thanks for sharing it.
I have made this several times already and it is loved by all!
The whole family loved this! After it was done cooking we added a can of corn and a can of black beans. Reaheats great!!
Very easy to follow. I did add shrimp and tomatoes. I also cooked my rice prior. It was delicious!
I used one tablespoon Emeril's essence (you can find his recipe online) in place of the cayenne pepper. My family loved it!
